content: dual degree phd positions on printed electronic tattoos -carnegie mellon  portugal  program deadline december. 15. 2017 soft machines laboratory at carnegie mellon university (cmu) and the institute of systems and robotics at university of coimbra (uc) have joint phd openings in the area of soft robotics. students will receive a dual degree through the carnegie mellon  portugal  program ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cmu portugal .org_&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wrxrozsqegykjqaacd44zmmczpeooklz5dklzi19vh4&s=itj-1g1vag5al-oy7_pghzbn4dnfi891yg1atzbggac&e=) and spend two years each at uc and cmu.  their dissertational research will focus on printed electronic tattoos, e-skins, and mechatronic systems that will be used on wearable bio-monitoring, human machine interaction, prosthetic and robotics. we are particularly looking for candidates with hands-on experience in microfabrication, additive manufacturing, ai, and/or mechatronics. interested phd applicants should apply online to the doctoral program in computer science-robotics: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cmu portugal .org_tiercontent.aspx-3fid-3d546&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wrxrozsqegykjqaacd44zmmczpeooklz5dklzi19vh4&s=aftvesnwsfx9okwof-t6qw2tbszukquvqpbw8vrzie8&e=. in your application, please refer to the following eri project: cmup-eri/tic/0021/2014 on soft robotics and wearable technology.  after applications send a notification with your cv to mahmoud tavakoli (mahmoud at isr.uc.pt)  anibal t. de almeida ( adealmeida at isr.uc.pt) and carmel majidi (cmajidi at andrew.cmu.edu). for questions contact (mahmoud at isr.uc.pt).

subject: phd scholarships in robotics at queen  mary university of london
content: *phd scholarships in *electronic engineering and computer science (including *robotics*) at the *queen mary university of london (qmul)*, uk. dear colleagues, we have a number of phd scholarships available in the field of intelligent robotics (see details below). if you are interested in any of them, please send me an email (l.jamone at qmul.ac.uk) with subject "qmul phd robotics: <your full name>"), including: a) your full cv; b) transcript of records; c) a cover letter (i.e. motivation statement) of 1 page maximum; d) at least two academic references. details are reported below about: *1) one fully-funded phd scholarship in robot vision; for uk/eu applicants.* *2) **eight fully-funded phd scholarships in *electronic engineering and computer science (including *robotics*); for applicants of any nationality. *3) ten hec phd scholarships in *electronic engineering and computer science (including *robotics*); for.i applicants. *4) several **fully-funded **phd scholarships in the intersection of media/* *design/art **and technology (including robotics); for applicants of any nationality.* all the phd scholarships are hosted by the queen mary university of london (qmul). qmul is a leading research oriented uk university, ranking top 20 in the uk and top 100 in the world (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_about_index.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=1ghdcumf8rjmynk6i_a9hamgvjl7otdx37yety5rpks&e=). located in the booming creative high-tech cluster of east london ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.sciencedirect.com_science_article_pii_s0264275112001552&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=ysaumrkmhccog6gjuvnc4kienm5uhomqrrou2_hb_x0&e=), the university hosts several multidisciplinary research groups in cognitive science, intelligent sensing, computer vision, multimedia, advanced materials, control, aerospace, and more. qmul has recently opened a new centre for robotics (arq - advanced robotics at queen mary, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_robotics_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=dimoe_ia-y22y48dnmkgkoojz1rf516gedtguneypk4&e=) and is seeking outstanding and highly motivated candidates for phd student positions (general entry requirements: www.qmul.ac.uk/postgraduate/research/applyresearchdegrees). *1) one fully-funded phd scholarship in robot vision.* applications are invited for a fully funded uk/eu phd studentship, on the topic of active vision for robotics. the successful candidate will develop vision-based robotic exploration and manipulation algorithms, for use in cluttered and low-visibility environments. this research will be part of a new epsrc robotics & artificial intelligence hub, addressing the management of legacy nuclear waste, which is coordinated by thenational centre for nuclear robotics <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.birmingham.ac.uk_research_activity_metallurgy-2dmaterials_robotics_national-2dcentre-2dnuclear-2drobotics.aspx&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=opi-ffxivnlai8vnepgadsd2tzfah6rmx7qtqmbvxmg&e=>. the phd position will be based in the advanced robotics group (arq) <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_media_news_items_se_200830.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=mchaq4gbs8l4rmx0yglfngs98jm3b7kuq1lktprympw&e=> at qmul, with access to state of the art equipment for sensing and robotics (including lidar and stereo systems, a ur5 robot arm, and an allegro robot hand). the successful candidate will be co-supervised by dr miles hansard <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_-7emilesh_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=cdrz8pejuvpl3lo84p2h75rehueee0q9oki8wewprzc&e=> and dr lorenzo jamone <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lorejam.blogspot.co.uk_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=157vjqts3hx7q60sowwnvqglekt-h_afvtcrayhh8wk&e=>, in the school of eecs. there will also be opportunities to collaborate with other members of the epsrc hub, including prof gerhard neumann <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__computational-2dlearning.net_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=rpmmxckhjlnflh7mqtxsk06yh5idfvn-sfryifu10bo&e=> at the university of lincoln. candidates should have a first class honours degree or equivalent (and preferably a masters degree) in computer science, engineering or a related field. strong programming skills in c++, matlab, or python are essential. knowledge of one or more of the following is desirable: multiple view geometry, reinforcement / deep learning, optimization algorithms, kinematics, depth cameras, spatial statistics, linux, ros. informal enquiries can be made by email to dr miles hansard ( miles.hansard at qmul.ac.uk). to apply please follow the on-line process https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=2wo6t3-sogdqlo7bqerg_yphx2y8bsnbgyxczsqbene&e= postgraduate/howtoapply/ by selecting 'computer science' in the 'a-z list of research opportunities' and following the instructions on the right hand side of the web page. please note that instead of the 'research proposal' we request a 'statement of research interests'. your statement of research interest should answer two questions: (i) why are you interested in the proposed area? (ii) what is your experience in the proposed area? your statement should be brief: no more than 500 words or one side of a4 paper. in addition we would also like you to send a sample of your written work. this might be a chapter of your final year dissertation, or a published conference or journal paper. more details can be found at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_phd_apply.php&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=y9yywvjkt6dx7plmgxou4fbaoh7sljc6uqhhnkftyg4&e= the closing date for applications is january 31st, 2018, followed by interviews in february. the starting date of the position will be subject to agreement. *2) **eight fully-funded phd scholarships in *electronic engineering and computer science (including *robotics*) (details can be found here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=vn5_lizdbdlr8mcoh6wcnl7t9jxzfvzixp27zm61bm8&e=. uk/phd/research-topics/funded#phd-studentships-in-electronic -engineering-and-computer-science3) the school of electronic engineering and computer science (eecs) at queen mary university of london (qmul) has eight fully-funded studentships for exceptional phd applicants to join our school. two types of studentships are available. applicants of all nationalities are eligible to apply for college studentships, and applicants who satisfy the engineering and physical sciences research council (epsrc) residence criteria https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.epsrc.ac.uk_skills_students_help_eligibility_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=kuuzsuzpkb0p-5hzwwhdqwjfngoddxro4lajzxvzbma&e= are eligible to apply for epsrc studentships. all studentships are planned to start in autumn 2018, and last for three (college) or three and a half (epsrc) years, subject to satisfactory progress. studentships cover tuition fees as well as a tax-free stipend of ?16,553 per annum (2017 rate, expected to increase for 2018 and subsequent years). specifically for robotics, you will have the chance to work on exciting topics such as advanced robotic manipulation, robot learning, tactile sensing, human-robot interaction, cognitive robotics, using state-of-the-art robotic platforms and interacting with other researchers in a vibrant and multidisciplinary research environment. join arq (advanced robotics at queen mary, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_robotics_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=dimoe_ia-y22y48dnmkgkoojz1rf516gedtguneypk4&e=) to work on one of these exciting topics under my supervision (dr lorenzo jamone,l.jamone at qmul.ac.uk), and in collaboration with the cognitive science group (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__cogsci.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=pp5cgmbbdbrf9qxzcy1uim3cdzfyzu7mi71hckquqgw&e=) and with the centre for intelligent sensing (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__cis.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=1scqhgupp7b1bhheypcmtsedcjc17webf7gqj9o8kok&e=). all applicants should hold a ms degree (or a bsc with proven experience in robotics) in electrical or computer engineering, computer science, mechanical engineering, or a field closely related to robotics. you need to be good at programming (c++, java, python, possibly ros), with basic electronics skills and with a good understanding of mathemathics and statistics, but most importantly you need to be highly motivated and ready to work very hard! applicants with advanced knowledge of robotics, control, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or previous research experience in these fields, are particularly encouraged to apply. specific topics in robotics: *intelligent robotics for future manufacturing and beyond* *https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_phd_research-2dtopics_projectideas-23intelligent&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=hvo0nyi6dqsw7dcp3yb7khbg0ynnqwuy_7uyx0z50eg&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_phd_research-2dtopics_projectideas-23intelligent&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=hvo0nyi6dqsw7dcp3yb7khbg0ynnqwuy_7uyx0z50eg&e=> incoming robotic revolution? are you interested in unraveling the mysteries of human intelligence, and equipping robots with advanced human-like abilities? *affordance learning and perception in humans and robots* *https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_phd_research-2dtopics_projectideas-23affordance&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=7ks63k3dita1lgkxxft7wgb0gapf7x0rmm0yqfohwga&e= are? how do you understand what can you do with an object, when you first see it (let's say, you see a pair of chopstick for the first time in your life, and nobody is there to tell you what they are...)?. what if you were an elephant, instead? how can we equip robots with similar perception and reasoning abilities? *tactile intelligence for smart and soft robots* *https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_phd_research-2dtopics_projectideas-23tactile&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ghejna_rqn5y8a_yjukbcawx0wylh3jggs4qajobiey&s=xbrodncwrgabefpwqdku2xsodh3kawa8rginwnas8_k&e= intelligence for smart and soft robots* the sense of touch is fundamental in humans to explore and learn about the own-body and the external world, and to be able to develop self-awareness and successfully interact with the environment. similarly, robots can use tactile sensing to learn about their bodies and how to interact with humans and objects. despite the recent advancements of tactile sensing technologies, their deployment in practical application is still quite limited, although the landscape of possible applications is huge: minimal invasive surgery, rehabilitation, telepresence, automation and robotics. by optimizing the design of soft sensors based on a technology we recently proposed (seehttp://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8000399/) this project will look at realizing deployable soft sensors for smart (and maybe soft) robots that can work both in industry and in public spaces, as well as intelligent control algorithms for these robot to learn from the tactile interactions. *3) ten hec phd scholarships in *electronic engineering and computer science (including *robotics*) the queen mary university of london, in partnership with the higher education subject: postdoctoral position: ai  planning/ml/embedded marine robotics/oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution for marine robotics norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 20th, 2018 apply at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eegaofeog4sdvdr1umkkcyy1u85uj3ctmshrosvu5-e&s=vt2xrw85bpwk3wjzmvc50jbqcgo3dhehajatfekkvww&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eegaofeog4sdvdr1umkkcyy1u85uj3ctmshrosvu5-e&s=vt2xrw85bpwk3wjzmvc50jbqcgo3dhehajatfekkvww&e=> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- a postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution working at the institute for engineering cybernetics (itk), at the norwegian univ. of science and tech (ntnu), trondheim, on the research council  norway  funded, ailaron project is available with an immediate start.  this project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum.  the project is about pulling together embedded machine vision with learning to track plankton species in space and time using an autonomous underwater vehicle (auv). we aim to couple a new plankton imager, with machine learned taxa using in-situ image processing with a compact hydro-dynamic model coupled to a model-based planning/execution system onboard a auv at ntnu.  this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  qualifications: the candidate must have:  a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning and vision will be a plus strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential a strong publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact willing and able to work in the field and go to sea a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 20th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their phd by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  norwegian salaries and benefits are generous and trondheim <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eegaofeog4sdvdr1umkkcyy1u85uj3ctmshrosvu5-e&s=yhzjyx6yyriw0ixaaidvfyq6otaedpewl_u8v2ckq1a&e=> is a university town on trondheimsfjord, connected via a high density air link to oslo, copenhagen, amsterdam and stockholm. english is the standard means of communication both at the university and in multi-cultural trondheim. the weather is strongly modulated by the gulf stream passing by the norwegian west coast just outside the fjord. skiing and outdoor activities abound.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no> with a subject line: ?postdoc: ailaron?.  url for candidates: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eegaofeog4sdvdr1umkkcyy1u85uj3ctmshrosvu5-e&s=vt2xrw85bpwk3wjzmvc50jbqcgo3dhehajatfekkvww&e= .com_about_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eegaofeog4sdvdr1umkkcyy1u85uj3ctmshrosvu5-e&s=32espbbu61ca_6ribqeol0f6afl5j2hkppvwvrbpbik&e= _en_home&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eegaofeog4sdvdr1umkkcyy1u85uj3ctmshrosvu5-e&s=xmn4pxzvlsiowgroq_9n-9pre0yuwlye95yvmr1kcim&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - practical info about  norway : https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.nyinorge.no_en_ny-2di-2dnorge-2dvelg-2dsprak_new-2din-2d norway _&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eegaofeog4sdvdr1umkkcyy1u85uj3ctmshrosvu5-e&s=imvu9nkjxf3uhpcbinyfmqmbe22ythfgp-pqtfwphtu&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> ntnu is  norway 's largest university, with an annual budget of almost usd 1 billion. its 70 departments are spread out over fourteen faculties, educating 39.000 students at any one time, of which half study technology and the natural sciences. ntnu graduates about 6.500 bachelor and master students every year, while about 380 doctoral degrees are awarded annually. the university has more than 100 laboratory facilities distributed among the different faculties and departments. these are central elements in ntnu's education and research work. many of the technological and cultural innovations that allow  norway  to extract oil and gas from the north sea, grow healthy salmon in fish farms, or interpret the country's 9.000 years of human history have been developed at ntnu. the university itself, founded in 1910, has contributed a solid century of academic achievements and discoveries that have shaped norwegian society.  trondheim was  norway 's first capital city, founded more than 1.000 years ago, in 997 - but now instead of viking raiders and hanseatic traders, you'll find jazz musicians and an international student body savouring trondheim city life. with a population of 187.353 (january 1, 2016), it is the third most populous municipality in  norway . with its snow-capped mountains, deep green valleys and sapphire blue fjords,  norway  is recognized the world over for its scenic beauty. combine that with  norway 's cultural heritage, and you'll find that living in  norway  has something to offer everyone. while  norway  lies at the very top of europe ? and in fact includes the island archipelago of svalbard, home to the most northerly communities on the planet ? the country's climate is moderated by the gulf stream, and features four distinct seasons.  norway 's natural beauty and a history of famous polar explorers are two reasons why the outdoors is such an important part of norwegian culture. newcomers to  norway  will find the norwegian work culture to be relaxed, but efficient. the typical work week is 37.5 hours long, with a generous summer holiday time and official holidays sprinkled throughout the year. the work culture reflects the culture at large, which is respectful of individual rights and supports a generous welfare system.

.com_about_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=o0jjsrzz79iuq4saur71lr6agwjqcty8tfwu2hayidg&s=tdfnxypqnmqzjr_o6hlokssw_ejftffsiol6_cfp4hg&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - working in  norway : https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.nav.no_workin norway _en_home&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=o0jjsrzz79iuq4saur71lr6agwjqcty8tfwu2hayidg&s=kg_q9oepibtjguyagin_m32pvroi3fq7ouxylgsfmvo&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.nyinorge.no_en_ny-2di-2dnorge-2dvelg-2dsprak_new-2din-2d norway _&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=o0jjsrzz79iuq4saur71lr6agwjqcty8tfwu2hayidg&s=sqlmxonal6z8ilyphizncwlpud1ln1peb5v26waherm&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> ntnu is  norway 's largest university, with an annual budget of almost usd 1 billion. its 70 departments are spread out over fourteen faculties, educating 39.000 students at any one time, of which half study technology and the natural sciences. ntnu graduates about 6.500 bachelor and master students every year, while about 380 doctoral degrees are awarded annually. the university has more than 100 laboratory facilities distributed among the different faculties and departments. these are central elements in ntnu's education and research work. many of the technological and cultural innovations that allow  norway  to extract oil and gas from the north sea, grow healthy salmon in fish farms, or interpret the country's 9.000 years of human history have been developed at ntnu. the university itself, founded in 1910, has contributed a solid century of academic achievements and discoveries that have shaped norwegian society.  trondheim was  norway 's first capital city, founded more than 1.000 years ago, in 997 - but now instead of viking raiders and hanseatic traders, you'll find jazz musicians and an international student body savouring trondheim city life. with a population of 187.353 (january 1, 2016), it is the third most populous municipality in  norway . with its snow-capped mountains, deep green valleys and sapphire blue fjords,  norway  is recognized the world over for its scenic beauty. combine that with  norway 's cultural heritage, and you'll find that living in  norway  has something to offer everyone. while  norway  lies at the very top of europe ? and in fact includes the island archipelago of svalbard, home to the most northerly communities on the planet ? the country's climate is moderated by the gulf stream, and features four distinct seasons.  norway 's natural beauty and a history of famous polar explorers are two reasons why the outdoors is such an important part of norwegian culture. newcomers to  norway  will find the norwegian work culture to be relaxed, but efficient. the typical work week is 37.5 hours long, with a generous summer holiday time and official holidays sprinkled throughout the year. the work culture reflects the culture at large, which is respectful of individual rights and supports a generous welfare system.

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  on active and healthy ageing and aal in general
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) -------------------------------------------------------------------- research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal  topics: active and healthy ageing, ambient assisted living, social robots, smart homes, human activity recognition, human-robot interaction. application deadline: january 22, 2018 (hard deadline) -------------------------------------------------------------------- one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=0i9hc8mpbrhyttoogukosu2cg4zidac9eaocxenj6km&e=),  portugal , starting in february 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - innovative initiatives for the promotion of active aging in the euroace region?, with the ref. poctep-0043_euroage_4_e, funded by the interreg v a  spain  -  portugal  program (poctep 2014-2020). the euroage project aims at fostering autonomous healthy life, mainly in elderly people but also in people with some degree of dependency, through the promotion of innovative initiatives based on information and communication technologies provided by the patterns participating in the project. the project involves  portugal - spain  cross-border cooperation of partners from euroace region, a region that covers centro and alentejo regions in  portugal , and extremadura region in  spain , which is a territory in iberian peninsula heavily affected by the ageing of the population. the research team from isr - university of coimbra that participates in the euroage project will demonstrate and validate with elderly people the use of social robots and smart homes as key technologies to promote active and healthy ageing, through cognitive, socio-emotional stimulation and physical activity promotion, thus contributing to quality of life enhancement and increased healthy life expectancy, mainly in the elderly population. the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the candidates must have high oral and written proficiency in english if her/his mother tongue is not the portuguese. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning techniques, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the euroage project. application procedure applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate and certificates of other academic degrees held by the candidate (e.g. b.sc.); ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter ? the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early february. important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=q1vm3ponv-o3xj_fkum6x5wnsoojssw5nyiir9r8fo8&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, mobile robotics, pattern recognition, machine learning, and computer vision; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in january 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]isr.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in euroage project?, *no later than january 22, 2018*. ______ rui p. rocha, ph.d. assistant professor institute of systems and robotics dept. of electrical and computer engineering university of coimbra universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=yct73ovcqhsrsqme1y6yr4eargibvhthuykbbt_tksk&e=), mostly from europe.

subject: postdoctoral position: ai  planning/ml/embedded marine robotics/oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution for marine robotics norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 20th, 2018 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- a postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution working at the institute for engineering cybernetics (itk), at the norwegian univ. of science and tech (ntnu), trondheim, on the research council  norway  funded, ailaron project is available with an immediate start.  this project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum.  the project is about pulling together embedded machine vision with learning to track plankton species in space and time using an autonomous underwater vehicle (auv). we aim to couple a new plankton imager, with machine learned taxa using in-situ image processing with a compact hydro-dynamic model coupled to a model-based planning/execution system onboard a auv.  this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning and vision will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a strong publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 20th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their phd by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  with a subject line: ?postdoc: ailaron?.  apply here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=zu7gclgdlct018q33ljuoszzvv4kqwonk6-c3vzab10&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=zu7gclgdlct018q33ljuoszzvv4kqwonk6-c3vzab10&e=> work environment: norwegian salaries and benefits are generous and trondheim <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=ry4clwrl4h2htw2tw7dtvjw0p5v-pdkcdd2acfrynqc&e=>  is a university town on trondheimsfjord, connected via a high density air link to oslo, copenhagen, amsterdam and stockholm. english is the standard means of communication both at the university and in multi-cultural trondheim. the weather is strongly modulated by the gulf stream passing by the norwegian west coast just outside the fjord. skiing and outdoor activities abound.  - about ntnu: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntnu.edu_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=vkl6152p65ubhraufzeem3eeqw1cm8rlqqq0deyn3b0&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - ntnu facts and figures: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntnu.edu_facts&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=_ngyrsykci-jb1ywb0ay3z9tnvcp0uyx87ud-7j_wb8&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - ntnu international researcher support: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntnu.edu_nirs&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=lkl5xxcigjvc0yx7flovswkjbbsaljlavbzq-dts0k0&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - about trondheim: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=l6itsrxqoem0dexje2wtfc-aulznznopfekojaafekg&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - about  norway : https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.visit norway .com_about_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=4b8x0zitmri4n8hodjxmu8kkbxi5_vgaufm7ylpyxze&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - working in  norway : https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.nav.no_workin norway _en_home&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=iis1dfvfc3t3g80zg0b0ghinvgqxiacheruunxe0ohe&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> - practical info about  norway : https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.nyinorge.no_en_ny-2di-2dnorge-2dvelg-2dsprak_new-2din-2d norway _&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v32bwr3xgoinv7il7lboonibmm_ctt_1ost3q7ecntc&s=zltfiskmicxbrpawn-noa7gh_ut9rnjvz6t5gzyt4i0&e= <applewebdata://908b62b0-bb8c-401c-9885-94cf2fc29f01/%22> regards -kanna rajan

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  on active and healthy ageing and aal in general in-reply-to: <1884206993.870263.1515502533675.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <1884206993.870263.1515502533675.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>

university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=l4eg2gxvqied0jmkzvf3vnarzfaxfgfnpfcllb8i7wa&s=jhtxoohd2v_0bzhqfuk7ria5t7c3hruqaskavvxkxda&e=),  portugal , starting in february 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=l4eg2gxvqied0jmkzvf3vnarzfaxfgfnpfcllb8i7wa&s=nufozkcnuln3edpmeq3xhb7vixyndcvthd9zjqscgj4&e=), mostly from europe.

subject: postdoctoral position: ai  planning/ml/embedded marine robotics/oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution for marine robotics norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 20th, 2018 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- a postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution working at the institute for engineering cybernetics (itk), at the norwegian univ. of science and tech (ntnu), trondheim, on the research council  norway  funded, ailaron project is available with an immediate start.  this project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum.  the project is about pulling together embedded machine vision with learning to track plankton species in space and time using an autonomous underwater vehicle (auv). we aim to couple a new plankton imager, with machine learned taxa using in-situ image processing with a compact hydro-dynamic model coupled to a model-based planning/execution system onboard a auv.  this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning and vision will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a strong publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 20th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their phd by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  with a subject line: ?postdoc: ailaron?.  apply here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jxabr_tx4csj6fqfsbhpmve7us5dijrzy2melxpllyu&s=j5rpkqac3rqrazsmb-hiotxxqj8s3rpqnruxrf0xrgy&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jxabr_tx4csj6fqfsbhpmve7us5dijrzy2melxpllyu&s=j5rpkqac3rqrazsmb-hiotxxqj8s3rpqnruxrf0xrgy&e=> work environment: norwegian salaries and benefits are generous and trondheim <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jxabr_tx4csj6fqfsbhpmve7us5dijrzy2melxpllyu&s=7rp5-ryuv6b0myuvrwthmunsmr6srvyegzyrrhogqla&e=>  is a university town on trondheimsfjord, connected via a high density air link to oslo, copenhagen, amsterdam and stockholm. english is the standard means of communication both at the university and in multi-cultural trondheim. the weather is strongly modulated by the gulf stream passing by the norwegian west coast just outside the fjord. skiing and outdoor activities abound.  - subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  - artificial perception for multi-robot surveillance of  infrastructures in-reply-to: <361634640.1220083.1516697305364.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <361634640.1220083.1516697305364.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal   topics: artificial perception, machine learning, semantic mapping,  cooperative perception, multi-robot surveillance of infrastructures.  application deadline: february 7, 2018 (hard deadline)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=zoxpraslo7n4kgsm5wobcw7mlpfucftojqrjjfbk4mm&s=rzi8zqcwqz8anmrpll2a-mjk5-1if-f1nnyfswwvyge&e=),  portugal , starting in march 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?stop ? cooperative robotic securities?, funded by the ? portugal  2020? (pt2020) program, co-funded by the european regional development fund (erdf). the project stop aims at pursuing research on automatic patrolling of infrastructures by mobile robots, and developing innovative technical features in order to adapt the intended multi-robot systems to real scenarios, namely the automatic perception of security threats and other abnormal situations, as well as the resilient operation during long periods of time. the research engineer will integrate a multidisciplinary research team involved in several nationally and internationally funded excellence research programs.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the project stop. besides these core competencies, knowledge and experience on mobile robotics and computer vision will also be valued.  application procedure  applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents:  i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate;  ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation;  iii) motivation letter - the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early march 2018.  important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=zoxpraslo7n4kgsm5wobcw7mlpfucftojqrjjfbk4mm&s=minw-ahx08nsxpqlujov6hr9hmfhml1icj4i4rxf4qy&e=  for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application.  the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents:  - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, pattern recognition, machine learning, and mobile robotics;  - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects;  - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation.  since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in mid-feb. 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv.  the application must be sent in pdf format to rui.rocha[at]uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in project stop?, *no later than february 7, 2018*.  ______  rui p. rocha, ph.d.  assistant professor  institute of systems and robotics  dept. of electrical and computer engineering  university of coimbra  universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii  3030-290 coimbra,  portugal   e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc. tel.: +351 239 796 256  skype: rprocha  web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha  _______  founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them.  the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=zoxpraslo7n4kgsm5wobcw7mlpfucftojqrjjfbk4mm&s=raxlucxedirq1xd7lcbmwejxeotmc3p2ublk9pmw7zo&e=

subject: phd position: embedded ai  planning/execution for smallsat oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: phd position in embedded automated planning/execution for small satellites for ocean observation norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 10th, 2018 ?????????????????????????????????????????????? ntnu has recently established a research program, with a concerted and unified cross-disciplinary focus on designing, building and operating small satellites (or smallsats) as part of a coordinated system of autonomous robots and agents for maritime sensing, surveillance and communication. this phd position for onboard planning and execution with data analysis is to develop methods and systems for autonomous coordinated observation from a smallsat in close cooperation with robotic agents such as unmanned aerial (uav), surface (usv) and underwater vehicles (auv).  the research will be driven by the use of a hyper-spectral imaging payload that will be launched in a smallsat in a low-earth orbit within the project. the research will build on methods in temporal constraint-based automated planning and execution which have previously been used in space to command nasa?s deep space one spacecraft and the mixed-initiative control (mapgen) of the 2003 mars exploration rovers (mer) mission. our vision is that smallsats should be affordable, single purpose with dedicated capabilities, software-centric, and seen as an integral part of robotic agents coupled with in-situ presence using autonomous aerial, surface and underwater vehicles for a portable earth observation network that can be actively designed, configured, operated and controlled to fulfill specific mission objectives.  the project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum. this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 10th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their phd by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  or tor.arne.johansen at ntnu.no <mailto:tor.arne.johansen at ntnu.no> with a subject line: ?phd: massive?.  apply here: subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  - artificial perception for multi-robot surveillance of  infrastructures in-reply-to: <1211420841.1224262.1516701117454.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <361634640.1220083.1516697305364.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>  <1211420841.1224262.1516701117454.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal   topics: artificial perception, machine learning, semantic mapping,  cooperative perception, multi-robot surveillance of infrastructures.  application deadline: february 7, 2018 (hard deadline)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=3r6qngxpbee5mto_udh08bevistobs2v4xdn4ywhw4c&s=65i1bwqp368kj5cy4m56omkzakd_t_juluyixm0xi58&e=),  portugal , starting in march 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?stop ? cooperative robotic securities?, funded by the ? portugal  2020? (pt2020) program, co-funded by the european regional development fund (erdf). the project stop aims at pursuing research on automatic patrolling of infrastructures by mobile robots, and developing innovative technical features in order to adapt the intended multi-robot systems to real scenarios, namely the automatic perception of security threats and other abnormal situations, as well as the resilient operation during long periods of time. the research engineer will integrate a multidisciplinary research team involved in several nationally and internationally funded excellence research programs.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the project stop. besides these core competencies, knowledge and experience on mobile robotics and computer vision will also be valued.  application procedure  applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents:  i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate;  ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation;  iii) motivation letter - the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early march 2018.  important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=3r6qngxpbee5mto_udh08bevistobs2v4xdn4ywhw4c&s=xufaff4e2-_b3sajlu9isuqehawbg6tu693ve0dt2vs&e=  for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application.  the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents:  - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, pattern recognition, machine learning, and mobile robotics;  - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects;  - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation.  since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in mid-feb. 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv.  the application must be sent in pdf format to rui.rocha[at]uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in project stop?, *no later than february 7, 2018*.  ______  rui p. rocha, ph.d.  assistant professor  institute of systems and robotics  dept. of electrical and computer engineering  university of coimbra  universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii  3030-290 coimbra,  portugal   e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc. tel.: +351 239 796 256  skype: rprocha  web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha  _______  founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them.  the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=3r6qngxpbee5mto_udh08bevistobs2v4xdn4ywhw4c&s=ahiyy3uok8jbzfinethl_nhufcroefs8taw4kqwlsag&e=

subject: phd position: embedded ai  planning/execution for smallsat oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: phd position in embedded automated planning/execution for small satellites for ocean observation norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 10th, 2018 ?????????????????????????????????????????????? ntnu has recently established a research program, with a concerted and unified cross-disciplinary focus on designing, building and operating small satellites (or smallsats) as part of a coordinated system of autonomous robots and agents for maritime sensing, surveillance and communication. this phd position for onboard planning and execution with data analysis is to develop methods and systems for autonomous coordinated observation from a smallsat in close cooperation with robotic agents such as unmanned aerial (uav), surface (usv) and underwater vehicles (auv).  the research will be driven by the use of a hyper-spectral imaging payload that will be launched in a smallsat in a low-earth orbit within the project. the research will build on methods in temporal constraint-based automated planning and execution which have previously been used in space to command nasa?s deep space one spacecraft and the mixed-initiative control (mapgen) of the 2003 mars exploration rovers (mer) mission. our vision is that smallsats should be affordable, single purpose with dedicated capabilities, software-centric, and seen as an integral part of robotic agents coupled with in-situ presence using autonomous aerial, surface and underwater vehicles for a portable earth observation network that can be actively designed, configured, operated and controlled to fulfill specific mission objectives.  the project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum. this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 10th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their phd by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  or tor.arne.johansen at ntnu.no <mailto:tor.arne.johansen at ntnu.no> with a subject line: ?phd: massive?.  apply here: <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lpe4wbysrktdl_7xllyptubndtcfz3auagyqvacidpu&s=p1ao6ja6m0nodydyfari-xntc5qwoxn9vpumm_86xsa&e=>  is a university town on trondheimsfjord, connected via a high density air link to oslo, copenhagen, amsterdam and stockholm. english is the standard means of communication both at the university and in multi-cultural trondheim. the weather is strongly modulated by the gulf stream passing by the norwegian west coast just outside the fjord. skiing and outdoor activities abound.  - about ntnu: subject: postdoctoral position: ai  planning/ml/embedded marine robotics/oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: [typo corrected ? apologies for the error regarding who can apply] postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution for marine robotics norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 20th, 2018 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- a postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution working at the institute for engineering cybernetics (itk), at the norwegian univ. of science and tech (ntnu), trondheim, on the research council  norway  funded, ailaron project is available with an immediate start.  this project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum.  the project is about pulling together embedded machine vision with learning to track plankton species in space and time using an autonomous underwater vehicle (auv). we aim to couple a new plankton imager, with machine learned taxa using in-situ image processing with a compact hydro-dynamic model coupled to a model-based planning/execution system onboard a auv.  this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning and vision will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a strong publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 20th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their masters by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  with a subject line: ?postdoc: ailaron?.  apply here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ir31nyd2o4s8ln3bksrneoctf1u9yfojzus_zk1w5vk&s=qs3xb4v1vb46eq0fndpwvme7vf5hjfgkykue-vspiza&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ir31nyd2o4s8ln3bksrneoctf1u9yfojzus_zk1w5vk&s=qs3xb4v1vb46eq0fndpwvme7vf5hjfgkykue-vspiza&e=> work environment: norwegian salaries and benefits are generous and trondheim <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ir31nyd2o4s8ln3bksrneoctf1u9yfojzus_zk1w5vk&s=l6b4rattsox5l-mvjre3ayoqlwc34mrme9uoi9evzkk&e=>  is a university town on trondheimsfjord, connected via a high density air link to oslo, copenhagen, amsterdam and stockholm. english is the standard means of communication both at the university and in multi-cultural trondheim. the weather is strongly modulated by the gulf stream passing by the norwegian west coast just outside the fjord. skiing and outdoor activities abound.  -
