subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  - artificial perception for multi-robot surveillance of  infrastructures in-reply-to: <1021943098.1363030.1517212574560.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <361634640.1220083.1516697305364.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>  <1211420841.1224262.1516701117454.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>  <1021943098.1363030.1517212574560.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal   topics: artificial perception, machine learning, semantic mapping,  cooperative perception, multi-robot surveillance of infrastructures.  application deadline: february 7, 2018 (hard deadline)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=mybiciiuihf2wrthachrnqs8z6vqvtfojtaa3oodv-m&s=u4qjtuzzgychkdq9xji4pse_y4_pg8qeowtbcgvebcm&e=),  portugal , starting in march 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?stop ? cooperative robotic securities?, funded by the ? portugal  2020? (pt2020) program, co-funded by the european regional development fund (erdf). the project stop aims at pursuing research on automatic patrolling of infrastructures by mobile robots, and developing innovative technical features in order to adapt the intended multi-robot systems to real scenarios, namely the automatic perception of security threats and other abnormal situations, as well as the resilient operation during long periods of time. the research engineer will integrate a multidisciplinary research team involved in several nationally and internationally funded excellence research programs.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the project stop. besides these core competencies, knowledge and experience on mobile robotics and computer vision will also be valued.  application procedure  applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents:  i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate;  ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation;  iii) motivation letter - the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early march 2018.  important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=mybiciiuihf2wrthachrnqs8z6vqvtfojtaa3oodv-m&s=mtz8fklagju0bvrun02steh5cgfgj1xwdknq_rmlu2o&e=  for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application.  the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents:  - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, pattern recognition, machine learning, and mobile robotics;  - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects;  - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation.  since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in mid-feb. 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv.  the application must be sent in pdf format to rui.rocha[at]uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in project stop?, *no later than february 7, 2018*.  ______  rui p. rocha, ph.d.  assistant professor  institute of systems and robotics  dept. of electrical and computer engineering  university of coimbra  universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii  3030-290 coimbra,  portugal   e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc. tel.: +351 239 796 256  skype: rprocha  web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha  _______  founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them.  the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=mybiciiuihf2wrthachrnqs8z6vqvtfojtaa3oodv-m&s=dayj5ysjxxed1rr1npejcwteactoismhmzia7lod7kq&e=

subject: phd position: embedded ai  planning/execution for smallsat oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: phd position in embedded automated planning/execution for small satellites for ocean observation norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 10th, 2018 ?????????????????????????????????????????????? ntnu has recently established a research program, with a concerted and unified cross-disciplinary focus on designing, building and operating small satellites (or smallsats) as part of a coordinated system of autonomous robots and agents for maritime sensing, surveillance and communication. this phd position for onboard planning and execution with data analysis is to develop methods and systems for autonomous coordinated observation from a smallsat in close cooperation with robotic agents such as unmanned aerial (uav), surface (usv) and underwater vehicles (auv).  the research will be driven by the use of a hyper-spectral imaging payload that will be launched in a smallsat in a low-earth orbit within the project. the research will build on methods in temporal constraint-based automated planning and execution which have previously been used in space to command nasa?s deep space one spacecraft and the mixed-initiative control (mapgen) of the 2003 mars exploration rovers (mer) mission. our vision is that smallsats should be affordable, single purpose with dedicated capabilities, software-centric, and seen as an integral part of robotic agents coupled with in-situ presence using autonomous aerial, surface and underwater vehicles for a portable earth observation network that can be actively designed, configured, operated and controlled to fulfill specific mission objectives.  the project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum. this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 10th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their masters/undergradute by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  or tor.arne.johansen at ntnu.no <mailto:tor.arne.johansen at ntnu.no> with a subject line: ?phd: massive?.  apply here: subject: postdoctoral position: ai  planning/ml/embedded marine robotics/oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: [apologies if you receive multiple copies of this announcement] postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution for marine robotics norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 20th, 2018 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- a postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution working at the institute for engineering cybernetics (itk), at the norwegian univ. of science and tech (ntnu), trondheim, on the research council  norway  funded, ailaron project is available with an immediate start.  the project is about pulling together embedded machine vision with learning to track plankton species in space and time using an autonomous underwater vehicle (auv). we aim to couple a new plankton imager, with machine learned taxa using in-situ image processing with a compact hydro-dynamic model coupled to a model-based planning/execution system onboard a auv.  this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  this project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum.  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning and vision will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a strong publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 20th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their phd by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  with a subject line: ?postdoc: ailaron?.  apply here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vq31uglotzjk9f_7hyynxnimwq5igahl7j17joqysak&s=ck4jzlxddd7gev7ctmis_2zrdcrgzlvdrgh3bhtk9eq&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vq31uglotzjk9f_7hyynxnimwq5igahl7j17joqysak&s=ck4jzlxddd7gev7ctmis_2zrdcrgzlvdrgh3bhtk9eq&e=> work environment: norwegian salaries and benefits are generous and trondheim <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vq31uglotzjk9f_7hyynxnimwq5igahl7j17joqysak&s=76kte8h2o623_sshiklmaqsiwovqlwaj8riop4sbjxw&e=>  is a university town on trondheimsfjord, connected via a high density air link to oslo, copenhagen, amsterdam and stockholm. english is the standard means of communication both at the university and in multi-cultural trondheim. the weather is strongly modulated by the gulf stream passing by the norwegian west coast just outside the fjord. skiing and outdoor activities abound.  - subject: postdoctoral position: ai  planning/ml/embedded marine robotics/oceanography, trondheim,  norway
content: [apologies if you receive multiple copies of this announcement] postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution for marine robotics norwegian university of science and technology (ntnu), trondheim,  norway  deadline: feb 20th, 2018 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- a postdoctoral position in automated planning/execution working at the institute for engineering cybernetics (itk), at the norwegian univ. of science and tech (ntnu), trondheim, on the research council  norway  funded, ailaron project is available with an immediate start.  the project is about pulling together embedded machine vision with learning to track plankton species in space and time using an autonomous underwater vehicle (auv). we aim to couple a new plankton imager, with machine learned taxa using in-situ image processing with a compact hydro-dynamic model coupled to a model-based planning/execution system onboard a auv.  this is a highly inter-disciplinary venture working with biologists and biological and physical oceanographers in trondheim and  portugal .  this project lies within an ecosystem of embedded robotics, artificial intelligence, control theory, machine vision, remote sensing and data analytics, focused on the ocean sciences for the study of the changing climate.  smallsats (space), aerial (uavs), surface (usvs) and underwater (auvs) vehicles for coordinated oceanographic observations are the basis to observe the changing oceans over large spatio-temporal scales ? this project is at the micro end of the observational spectrum.  qualifications: the candidate must have:  - a strong background in ai planning, and automated reasoning, interests in machine learning and vision will be a plus - strong programming skills in c++, c, python and java is essential - a strong publication record in peer-reviewed journals and conferences - a deep desire to work across traditional disciplinary lines and to have societal impact - willing and able to work in the field and go to sea - a strong desire to work in teams, be articulate and communicate well the deadline for application is february 20th, 2018. all candidates should send their applications via the web site below. candidates who will complete and defend their phd by may 2018 are welcome. women and minorities are particularly welcome.  enquiries to kanna.rajan at ntnu.no <mailto:kanna.rajan at ntnu.no>  with a subject line: ?postdoc: ailaron?.  apply here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=isafsj4-cujdwlhedxmf5d7uxidtj9edc4ylow1fuly&s=ettiiioyjfvssbyzkfuujidmjfhrg0kkkiuhb8xmo9a&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2bndtx7&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=isafsj4-cujdwlhedxmf5d7uxidtj9edc4ylow1fuly&s=ettiiioyjfvssbyzkfuujidmjfhrg0kkkiuhb8xmo9a&e=> work environment: norwegian salaries and benefits are generous and trondheim <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__trondheim.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=isafsj4-cujdwlhedxmf5d7uxidtj9edc4ylow1fuly&s=ixcgfwmgaper8r8_qozdjgqwn3x7-qii5pcw7rcojqm&e=>  is a university town on trondheimsfjord, connected via a high density air link to oslo, copenhagen, amsterdam and stockholm. english is the standard means of communication both at the university and in multi-cultural trondheim. the weather is strongly modulated by the gulf stream passing by the norwegian west coast just outside the fjord. skiing and outdoor activities abound.  - subject: phd research fellowship at ist-lisboa
content: research fellowship in robotic biomimetic oculomotor control https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__drh.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_files_sites_45_bl84-2d2.pdf&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jqatfsb-s-s2pk5ip1-zpc87vwprlqhlvlfi9pqhtom&s=lhhyr5dcyhnwgtheqbv-hi3gn76cxp4j_g2jppslck4&e= the computer and robot vision lab of the institute for systems and robotics at t?cnico lisboa invites applications for a *6 month research fellowship* on robotic biomimetic oculomotor control. this fellowship is proposed in the context of a collaboration with the erc project orient, of prof. john van opstal from the radboud university at nijmegen, the netherlands. the ideal candidate should *hold a degree *(bsc, msc) on electrical, computer, mechanics, aerospace, biomedical or physics engineering, and be* willing to apply and engage in an international phd programme.* the position comes with a monthly grant of 980?. depending on the work achievements, *after the 6 month grant the candidate can apply for the 3 year phd grant. * *project background:* humans are extremely fast and efficient in relocating their gaze direction to different points in the visual field through saccadic eye movements. however, current robots are still unable to achieve similar performances. this project aims to bring robots closer to the human performance by exploiting modern control theory, computer vision, and machine learning algorithms, all applied to a novel 3d biomechanical system, which was designed according to the kinematics of the human eye. simultaneously, we will uncover the neural mechanisms that biological systems may use to control complex motor systems with redundant degrees of freedom. the work consists of the implementation of a *oculomotor kinematics and dynamics control systems following biomimetic principles on a realistic mechanical model of a human eye*. *the work should culminate with the proposal of a workplan for a 3 year project at the level of a phd. * the candidates are required to demonstrate good analytical, programming and writing skills. knowledge on modelling, control, robotics, computer vision and/or machine learning will be highly considered. applications assembled to a single pdf file should contain: (1) cover letter (max 1 page) (2) cv (3) certificate of academic degree with grades. (4) name and contact of two referees. (5) application form model b1 in https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__drh.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_bolseiros_formularios_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jqatfsb-s-s2pk5ip1-zpc87vwprlqhlvlfi9pqhtom&s=65xvlimk87mwcxc_-sgktdgmzllfnbola9ecbzzrzws&e= shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview. applications are open from 16th april 2018 to 15th may 2018. applications should be sent to: alex at isr.tecnico.ulisboa.[subject line: orient2018] official documents: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__drh.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_files_sites_45_bl84-2d2.pdf&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jqatfsb-s-s2pk5ip1-zpc87vwprlqhlvlfi9pqhtom&s=lhhyr5dcyhnwgtheqbv-hi3gn76cxp4j_g2jppslck4&e= --  alexandre bernardino associate professor, instituto superior t?cnico senior researcher, institute for systems and robotics ist - torre norte, 7? - av. rovisco pais, 1049-001 lisboa.  portugal  tel. +351-218418293, fax. +351-218418291, web: isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/ <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.isr.ist.utl.pt_-7ealex&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jqatfsb-s-s2pk5ip1-zpc87vwprlqhlvlfi9pqhtom&s=rf2swkdg28lrkwqhrqvswv6gha31i6hbhidestxzilo&e=>~alex

subject: post-doctoral research fellowship in  robotic biomimetic oculomotor control
content: post-doctoral research fellowship in robotic biomimetic oculomotor control https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__drh.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_files_sites_45_bl126.pdf&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cwvroextxdwkqlzxwsh3u2lxctz8atn8rocfeizirr8&s=iuxtznwpx4pmnsxmvvkdwfs-xyy-v8h0qgmjiu4ba7s&e= the computer and robot vision lab of the institute for systems and robotics at t?cnico lisboa invites applications for a *12 month research post-doc research fellowship, renewable for up to **2.5** years* on robotic biomimetic oculomotor control. this fellowship is proposed in the context of a collaboration with the erc project orient, of prof. john van opstal from the radboud university at nijmegen, the netherlands. the ideal candidate should *hold a phd degree **for up to three years, *on electrical, computer, mechanics, aerospace, biomedical or physics engineering. *we search someone with a **strong background on systems modelling and control, and preferably knowledge on computer vision and machine learning. * *project background: *humans are extremely fast and efficient in relocating their gaze direction to different points in the visual field through saccadic eye movements. however, current robots are still unable to achieve similar performances. this project aims to bring robots closer to the human performance by exploiting modern control theory, computer vision, and machine learning algorithms, all applied to a novel 3d biomechanical system, which was designed according to the kinematics of the human eye. simultaneously, we will uncover the neural mechanisms that biological systems may use to control complex motor systems with redundant degrees of freedom. the work consists of the development of *oculomotor kinematics and dynamics control systems, following biomimetic principles on a realistic mechanical model of the human visual-motor system*, as well as the co-supervision of phd and msc students working on the project and helping on the management of project related issues. the work will be supervised by prof. alexandre bernardino at ist in close collaboration with prof. john van opstal. the position comes with a net monthly grant between 1495 - 2060 ? (*12* months per year; note; cost of living in lisbon is 70% of that in brussels). depending on the work achievements, *the **grant** can be renewed for up to 2.5 years. * applications assembled to a single pdf file should contain: (1) cover letter (max 1 page) (2) cv (3) certificate of academic degree with grades. (4) name and contact of two referees. (5) application form model b1 in https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__drh.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_bolseiros_formularios_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cwvroextxdwkqlzxwsh3u2lxctz8atn8rocfeizirr8&s=xjdujbwhtfvzekzdxoienu2fbp7licwdwjrordngsoc&e= shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview. applications are open from 18th june 2018 to 17th july 2018. applications should be sent to: alexandre.bernardino at tecnico.ulisboa.[subject line: orient2018] official documents: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__drh.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_files_sites_45_bl126.pdf&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cwvroextxdwkqlzxwsh3u2lxctz8atn8rocfeizirr8&s=iuxtznwpx4pmnsxmvvkdwfs-xyy-v8h0qgmjiu4ba7s&e= --  alexandre bernardino associate professor, instituto superior t?cnico senior researcher, institute for systems and robotics ist - torre norte, 7? - av. rovisco pais, 1049-001 lisboa.  portugal  tel. +351-218418293, fax. +351-218418291, web: www.isr.ist.utl.pt/~alex

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  - artificial perception for multi-robot surveillance of  infrastructures in-reply-to: <1466558371.133428.1532687483724.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <1466558371.133428.1532687483724.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) -------------------------------------------------------------------- research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal  topics: artificial perception, cooperative perception, semantic mapping, multi-robot surveillance of infrastructures. application deadline: september 3, 2018 (hard deadline) -------------------------------------------------------------------- one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=_tjgdyzekhx_waxsklh8cleceydqoihk3qruzzuyvck&s=jpegv9fj0vl-zbnlt2wdqg6sh8jcwrvmz3mtqj7sw2k&e=),  portugal , starting in october 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?stop ? cooperative robotic securities?, funded by the ? portugal  2020? (pt2020) program, co-funded by the european regional development fund (erdf). the project stop aims at pursuing research on automatic patrolling of infrastructures by mobile robots, and developing innovative technical features in order to adapt the intended multi-robot systems to real scenarios, namely the automatic perception of security threats and other abnormal situations, as well as the resilient operation during long periods of time. the research engineer will integrate a multidisciplinary research team involved in several nationally and internationally funded excellence research programs.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), or in canada or usa**. the ideal candidate would have solid knowledge and experience on mobile robotics and computer vision, excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the project stop. application procedure applicants must send by email **in pdf format** the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate; ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter demonstrating their motivation and adequacy of their cv to get involved in the stop project. important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=_tjgdyzekhx_waxsklh8cleceydqoihk3qruzzuyvck&s=d-pma6mziqg1f68ov4wkusoztvn6mr8vpcyabfsofbm&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with mobile robotics, computer vision, and ros; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in early-sep. 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]isr.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in project stop?, *no later than september 3, 2018*. ______ rui p. rocha, ph.d. assistant professor institute of systems and robotics dept. of electrical and computer engineering university of coimbra universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=_tjgdyzekhx_waxsklh8cleceydqoihk3qruzzuyvck&s=9oahdsekzexf17-mhuhzskjfbjhjqgnhjfpsrlnz8hy&e=), mostly from europe.

content: (apologies for cross-postings; please help us spread the word as you see fit). -------------------------------------------------------------------- research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal  topics: artificial perception, cooperative perception, semantic mapping, multi-robot surveillance of infrastructures. application deadline: september 3, 2018 (hard deadline) -------------------------------------------------------------------- one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9gqzntavvona579hzzefnej7xx6vdnrxtroblfgigee&s=akgyow3uujysrjnzg6tw5ufe3vmrhwebyg9fdqu_jsi&e=),  portugal , starting in october 2018. the researcher will be supervised by prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?stop ? cooperative robotic securities?, funded by the ? portugal  2020? (pt2020) program, co-funded by the european regional development fund (erdf).  the project stop follows the research promoted at the university of coimbra by the institute of systems and robotics, in order to demonstrate, through ingeniarius, ltd., the economic and technical advantages associated with cooperative multi-robot patrolling. such evidences are being put in place by the technological center of ceramics and glass, before a specialized audience (e.g., security teams), and in real situations (e.g., surveillance of buildings), validating the scientific methodologies developed in a technological perspective for commercial value. the research engineer will integrate this multidisciplinary research team involved in several nationally and internationally funded excellence research programs, focusing in the automatic perception of security threats and other abnormal situations.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), or in canada or usa**. the ideal candidate would have solid knowledge and experience on mobile robotics and computer vision, excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the project stop. application procedure applicants must send by email **in pdf format** the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate; ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter demonstrating their motivation and adequacy of their cv to get involved in the stop project. important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9gqzntavvona579hzzefnej7xx6vdnrxtroblfgigee&s=ezmnk0shargxjtquedkzud_eoz4olhrwu13djgkeofk&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with mobile robotics, computer vision, and ros; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in early-sep. 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]isr.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in project stop?, *no later than september 3, 2018*. ______ micael s. couceiro, ph.d. ceo ingeniarius, ltd. 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  3025 - 307 coimbra e-mail: micael[at]ingeniarius.tel.: +351 96 117 14 09 skype: micaelcouceiro _______

subject: postdoctoral research grant at the  ipfn/ist, university of lisbon, to work in multi-uav cooperative navigation
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) dear all, applications are open for one postdoctoral research grant at the institute for plasmas and nuclear fusion (ipfn), instituto superior t?cnico (ist), university of lisbon, to develop novel research work on the topic of multi-uav cooperative navigation. the selected candidate will work on a project of sar operations in scenarios of nuclear disaster, encompassing a fleet of drones. the project include the three main tasks: (1) autonomous and cooperative navigation of a fleet of autonomous drones, covering the area in an optimal way, in closed loop with the real-time construction of the contamination map, while maintaining exposure of the drones to radiation at a safe level, (2) real-time mapping of the scenario with the quantification of the contamination levels, and (3) assuring an effective and resilient wireless data communication among the drones and with the ground station. the selected candidate shall have expertise, at least, for one of these tasks and he/she will work with the support of 3 msc grantees, each one from a different research lab, with expertise for the different tasks.  the research work will be carried out in the context of a fully funded 3-year r&d project, in collaboration with different research labs with expertise in robotics, nuclear physics, and communications. high-quality scientific publications and participation on scientific conferences are expected during the lifetime of the project. the research will be conducted at ipfn (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ipfn.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ivr4okto-t05izyvtomxcolvox0f43ykpxv_v5echa&s=zauxmzgm1ugkodhmdl8u4hwxz8srynpvr_9-p1h0jdq&e=), one of the largest portuguese research units in physics and with more than 10 years of experience in remote handling with mobile robots in nuclear facilities (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ipfn.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_rh&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ivr4okto-t05izyvtomxcolvox0f43ykpxv_v5echa&s=7hfo7wvb_puwsnlkzofsl4ruojsa2rkq_otnjjxorda&e=). the role of the ipfn at national and international level was recognized in the last evaluation of r&d units by fct, the portuguese foundation of science and technology, where ipfn was awarded with the classification ?exceptional?. the research will also involve a strong collaboration with the other project partners: institute for systems and robotics (isr-lisboa, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ivr4okto-t05izyvtomxcolvox0f43ykpxv_v5echa&s=y3zit0wmnezdbn9yy14gi6x_mirappvt6z_obevc0ye&e=), instituto de telecomunica??es (it, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ww.it.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ivr4okto-t05izyvtomxcolvox0f43ykpxv_v5echa&s=onfmvzpwhewwmevvoe26nytadgd7feqthlq5qqelw34&e=), and technological and nuclear campus  (ctn, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.itn.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_ivr4okto-t05izyvtomxcolvox0f43ykpxv_v5echa&s=budbutyj_npgwo11scxpgs9zfm1ckqwzzf_1kwrb3sa&e=). requirements: the candidates are expected to hold a doctoral degree in electrical and computer engineering, computer science, aerospace engineering, technological physics engineering, or mechanical engineering. application: 	deadline: 16-september-2018 	duration of the grant: 30 months (full time), with possible extension 	expected starting date: october, 2018 	place: ist alameda campus, lisbon,  portugal  to request further information and to apply, send an email to rh-jobs at ipfn.tecnico.ulisboa. soon as possible. please include a cover letter and your curriculum-vitae, a statement of academic qualifications, and at least one reference willing to provide a recommendation letter. best regards, alberto vale (ipfn/ist) rodrigo ventura (isr-lisboa/ist)

subject: fully-funded phd scholarship in  robotics (queen mary university of london, uk)
content: *one fully-funded phd scholarship in intelligent robotic manipulation** at the queen mary university of london (qmul, **uk), for uk/eu candidates only.* dear colleagues, an exciting opportunity opens for a 3-years fully-funded phd position at arq (advanced robotics @ queen mary), the newly established robotics centre of the queen mary university of london, to work on a uk epsrc-funded project on intelligent robotic manipulation (see a recent press release here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.theengineer.co.uk_robots-2dobjects-2dmanipulation_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=koomolipvcrbr_gek6cq0vvntj0z80m1zanelycva5a&e=), starting on january 2019. if you are interested, please contact dr. lorenzo jamone ( l.jamone at qmul.ac.uk) *before 8 november 2018*, with subject "qmul phd robotics: <your full name>", including: a) your full cv; b) transcript of records; c) a cover letter (i.e. motivation statement) of 1 page maximum; d) at least two academic references. *details* can you imagine a world where humans and robots are seamlessly integrated and can effectively cooperate? do you want an active role in shaping this incoming robotic revolution? are you interested in unraveling the mysteries of human intelligence, and equipping robots with advanced human-like abilities? applications are invited for a fully-funded phd scholarship starting in january 2019 to undertake research in the area of intelligent robotic manipulation, in the context of the epsrc uk project ?man^3: human-inspired robotic manipulation for advanced manufacturing? (see a recent press release here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.theengineer.co.uk_robots-2dobjects-2dmanipulation_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=koomolipvcrbr_gek6cq0vvntj0z80m1zanelycva5a&e=). the project is led by the queen mary university of london, in collaboration with three companies based in london: google deepmind, shadow robot and ocado. the objective of the phd project is to employ techniques of artificial intelligence, human-robot interaction and force/tactile sensing to achieve human-like performance in the robotic manipulation of objects, using state-of-the-art robotic platforms (robot arm and hand) and interacting with other researchers in a vibrant and multidisciplinary research environment. the student will be based in the school of electronic engineering and computer science (www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk) at queen mary university of london, and will be a member of arq, the newly established advanced robotics centre at queen mary (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_robotics_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=kqu0igso6xutkkksiorxtplihb0qihomnnv8uu3mwcc&e=), under the supervision of dr lorenzo jamone ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__scholar.google.co.uk_citations-3fuser-3dglrd-2d2aaaaaj-26hl-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=h0a548x6nkd7fklx-aeyy8fkhjduxnsupdetlw9aknw&e=). candidates should have a first-class honours degree or equivalent, or a good msc degree, in electrical or mechanical engineering, computer science, or a field closely related to robotics. strong motivation to aim for excellence is essential. very good programming skills (c/c++, python) are also required, possibly including previous experience with ros. applicants with advanced knowledge of robotics, control, machine learning, artificial intelligence, tactile sensing and/or previous research experience in these fields, are particularly encouraged to apply. this studentship is available to eu candidates only (including uk candidates). it is funded by queen mary university of london for 3 years will cover student fees and a tax-free stipend starting at ?16,777 per annum. *to apply* to apply, please follow the *online process* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_postgraduate_howtoapply_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=ifpafymcaxe-qbxvtjxvvq_7qjejsis8tdhbvtrxkcs&e= by selecting ?electronic engineering? in the ?a-z list of research opportunities? and following the instructions on the right-hand side of the web page. general entry requirements: www.qmul.ac.uk/postgraduate/research/applyresearchdegrees. please note we request a ?statement of research interests?. your statement should answer three questions: (i) why are you interested in the topic and in the man^3 project? (ii) what relevant experience do you have? and (iii) a research proposal related to the topics of the man^3 project. your statement should be brief: no more than 750 words or one side of a4 paper. in addition we would also like you to send a sample of your written work. this might be a chapter of your final year dissertation, or a published conference or journal paper. more details can be found at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_phd_apply.php&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=dt4kjzebe1xib573teod6q1sfw1c3f7vrrwffz6rwae&e= the closing date for the online applications is *15 november 2018*. *qmul and arq* qmul (the queen mary university of london) is a leading research oriented uk university, ranking top 20 in the uk and top 100 in the world ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_about_index.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=gcshvbpw8-binywckvgvhrytwfycckq14wnmnbuq8_i&e=). located in the booming creative high-tech cluster of east london ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.sciencedirect.com_science_article_pii_s0264275112001552&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=bjqpvooy-ojjelw55apzfkzmcbnygz0xtsfescz2ku8&e=), the university hosts several multidisciplinary research groups in cognitive science, intelligent sensing, computer vision, multimedia, advanced materials, control, aerospace, and more. qmul has recently opened a new centre for robotics (arq - advanced robotics @ queen mary, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.qmul.ac.uk_robotics_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=j8z65tefhn-ttuum9t3xgtk-cclvrclbnofeb6gtate&e=), which is rapidly expanding and now counts more than 40 active brains including faculty members, postdocs, phd students and a few non-completely-brainless robots. join us! --  =================================================================== lorenzo jamone - lecturer in robotics arq - advanced robotics at queen mary school of electronic engineering and computer science - https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eecs.qmul.ac.uk_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=or4kjjtje2bbf0o_bppumldhttwqderaoq5r7mvtjqc&s=oqw19zsygut9g13418lueirs0z2sjsoy9j9qoemkmde&e= queen mary university of london - subject: research scientist position in  human-robot interaction at university of coimbra
content: research scientist position in human-robot interaction at university of coimbra online link with job and application details:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_drh_rm_pconcursais_investigadores_a-5fdecorrer_investigadores-5fdoutorados-5fdl-5f57-5f2016_it057-2d18-2d7411_aviso-5fen&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=p0s8bkrjokupbnwg8oonc0wblxbtnwevlte6t0bg9-c&s=ivy-8suekuoqnuho7u9nmqfn3uyueshgcbgpmqpenhc&e=  salary: 2128 ?/month education and other requirements: applicant should have a phd in robotics or related areas. thank you, pedro neto  professor  university of coimbra ? mechanical engineering  collaborative robotics laboratory (corluc)  rua lu?s reis santos ? polo ii | 3030-788 ? coimbra ?  portugal   tel: +351 239 790 767  (ext. 441416)  e-mail: pedro.neto at dem.uc. www.uc.| www2.dem.uc.pt/pedro.neto/

subject: two research engineer positions at  isr/ist for team participating in mbzirc 2020 robot competition
content: applications are invited for two fully funded research engineer positions at the institute for systems and robotics (isr), instituto superior t?cnico (ist), university of lisbon,  portugal . the selected candidates will be part of the u. seville/catec/isr-ist team participating in the mbzirc2020 robot competition (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.mbzirc.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r2enh9la4bj5-nqu_cv-uxsdpxkrf39ol5atnkwbja0&s=vyvuipaecp04fzwxab3iyoqn88bjioza03ir7jejx9q&e=) to be held in abu-dhabi, uae, 20-24 february 2020. these research engineer positions target candidates holding a master degree (or equivalent)^1. each of the selected candidates is expected to work, according to his/her preference, on one of the following two topics: a) development and integration of outdoor navigation and manipulation skills into tasks carried out by an unmanned ground vehicle (ugv), required to solve challenges 2 and 3 of mbzirc2020. b) development and management of the software architecture that will support the execution of tasks in a) by the ugv, as well as the development and implementation of the cooperation algorithms with the unmanned aerial vehicles (uavs) that will cooperate with the ugv on challenges 2 and 3 (responsible: u. seville + catec). these positions will be supervised by prof. pedro u. lima, prof. rodrigo ventura, dr. meysam basiri, and dr. alberto vale, faculty or research staff at ist and researchers at the intelligent robots and systems group of isr/ist (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__welcome.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_projects-5fcat_irsg_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r2enh9la4bj5-nqu_cv-uxsdpxkrf39ol5atnkwbja0&s=bfqj6t19sg_diskkczxmon3bmy5hthitkuc93ku9tge&e=). the research will be conducted at the intelligent robots and systems group of the institute for systems and robotics (isr/ist) (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__welcome.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_projects-5fcat_irsg_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r2enh9la4bj5-nqu_cv-uxsdpxkrf39ol5atnkwbja0&s=bfqj6t19sg_diskkczxmon3bmy5hthitkuc93ku9tge&e=). isr/ist is the home to more than 40 phds and part of the larsys (laboratory for robotics and engineering systems - https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.larsys.pt&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r2enh9la4bj5-nqu_cv-uxsdpxkrf39ol5atnkwbja0&s=yru6tog32ggkgfdibisa6-jnd5phfdkmfgqn1is0wzi&e=). isr/ist is engaged in a new generation of research challenges pushing the frontiers of knowledge, while offering world-class doctoral training with top universities (e.g. dual/joint degrees with mit, epfl, cmu) and fueling the collaboration with industry. isr/ist develops state-of- the-art engineering solutions and projects with a clear societal impact, and has a long track record of participation in eu and other international projects. (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r2enh9la4bj5-nqu_cv-uxsdpxkrf39ol5atnkwbja0&s=08pv7oomcktm49qkcppd9gt6v3pz70j3djfs-eya2le&e=). requirements: the candidates are expected to have a msc of equivalent degree with strong background in robotics, artificial intelligence, information/computer engineering or a mix of the three. good programming skills in python and/or c++, and experience with ros, are also expected. the working language is english, so good written and oral communication skills are also required. application:        deadline: 30-nov-2018        duration: 15 months (full time) ^2        starting date: january 2019        place: isr/ist - ist alameda campus, lisbon,  portugal  to request further information and to apply for these positions, send an email to pedro.lima at tecnico.ulisboa.indicating explicitly the position(s)/topic(s) you are applying to (a and/or b). please include: 	? a cv 	? a statement of interest 	? grade transcripts for relevant courses 	? recommendation letters, and  	? any other supporting documents you may consider helpful. all in a single attached zip or pdf file. ^1 - according to the portuguese law, selected candidates will need to obtain a degree equivalence to a portuguese degree ^2 - selected candidates will have a probatory period of 6 months after which the grant will be renewed up to 15 months if both parties agree.

subject: postdoctoral position in the area of  brain-computer interfaces
content: *call for a postdoctoral researcher in the area of brain-computer interfaces* 													 application deadline: november 23, 2018 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eracareers.pt_opportunities_index.aspx-3ftask-3dshowanunciooportunities-26jobid-3d104883-26idc-3d1&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zj7htywlca3n0fvahjp-onnrw0g6en9fz9vfnzzukfk&s=mnt_1r-rtyxcgaqvjn0njoub6s6d-cytbocousshb_q&e= *************************************************************************************************** reference isr-b-reliable/ct-posdoc/2018 instituto de sistemas e rob?tica (isr) - coimbra opens a call to hire a postdoctoral researcher corresponding to the initial level according to the applicable regulation, under an unfixed-term contract under sistema de apoio ? investiga??o cient?fica e tecnol?gica (saict) ? call nr. 02/saict/2017 - projeto de investiga??o cient?fica e desenvolvimento tecnol?gico (ic&dt), funded by investment and structural european funds (feei) - programa operacional regional do centro and national funds (fct) under the research project n?. 030935 ?boosting reliability and interaction on brain-machine interface systems integrating automatic error-detection? (b-reliable). regulation ?    decree-law nr 57/2016, from 29th august, altered by law nr 57/2017, from 19th july, that approves a doctoral hiring regime to stimulate scientific and technological employment in all knowledge areas (rjec). ?    portuguese labor law, approved by law nr 7/2009, from 12thfebruary in its current writing. ?    regulatory decree nr 11-a / 2017, of 29th december. 1.    goals and research topics to develop: this project aims to investigate and develop new methods, theoretical and computational models and respective experimental validation, in brain-computer / brain-machine interfaces (icc / icm) based on electroencephalography (eeg), aiming at: ?    increased reliability of iccs / icms for people with severe motor disabilities; ?    the creation of new and more natural forms of human-machine interaction and new paradigms of intervention and learning with neurofeedback, based on the automatic detection of error (originated by the human or the system); particular focus will be given to the research of an eeg signal called "error related potential" (errp), which occurs naturally in the brain as a response to errors, and its application in communication and mobility assistance systems for people with motor impairment, in advanced driver assistance systems for the general population, and in neuro-rehabilitation systems for children with neurodevelopmental disorders. the project is the result of a consortium between the institute of systems and robotics of coimbra (proponent), the university of coimbra - icnas (participating entity) and the polytechnic institute of tomar - vita (participating entity). the work will be carried out in a team composed of project researchers, research fellows, and phd and master students. 2.    members of the jury: according to article nr 13 from rjec, the jury is composed by gabriel pires (president of the jury and responsible for the project), urbano j. nunes (co-responsible for the project) and miguel castelo-branco (all phd?s). 3.    start date and workplace: the contract is expected to start in december 2018. the activities will be developed at isr-coimbra facilities (pole ii) and/or other necessary locations to their execution. 4.    monthly remuneration: gross monthly remuneration is 2.128,34?, in accordance with subsection a), section 1, article 15 from law nr 57/2017, 19th july, and with the remuneration position at initial level predicted in article 2 of regulatory decree nr 11-a/2017, of 29th december, correspondent to level 33 at tabela remunerat?ria ?nica, approved by order nr 1553-c/2008, 31st december. 5.    profile of candidate: any national, foreign and stateless candidate(s) that hold the following requirements can apply: ?    phd in electrical and computer engineering, or biomedical engineering, or computer engineering, or closely related area; ?    proven experience in signal processing and classification of electroencephalographic signals and in the development of brain-computer interfaces; ?    good programming skills in matlab and at least in one of the following languages: python, c / c++, c#; ?    experience in participating in scientific research projects and in the supervision of non-graduate students and/or research fellows; ?    proficiency in spoken and written english; important note: in the event the phd degree was awarded by a foreigner higher institution, the degree must comply with the provisions of decree-law nr 341/2007, 12th october, and all formalities established there must be fulfilled by applications deadline 6.    application process: the call is open from 12th october until 23rd november 2018 (30 working days), and the application documents (indicated below) should be sent, in pdf format, to the emailsgpires at isr.uc. andlara at isr.uc.pt, indicating the reference of the position reliable/ct-posdoc/2018 (mandatory): a)    motivation letter in english, including this announcement identification, full name, parents? names, id card, or citizen card number and date, or civil identification number, taxpayer id number, date and place of birth, marital status, occupation, residence and contact address, including email address and telephone; b)    detailed cv in english; c)    phd certificate; d)    orcid and scopus identifiers; e)    contact of 2 references. note: the non-compliance with these requirements determines the immediate rejection of application. 6.1    false statements provided by the candidates shall be punished by law. 6.2    isr-coimbra promotes a non-discrimination and equal access policy, wherefore no candidate can be privileged, benefited, impaired or deprived of any rights whatsoever, or be exempt of any duties based on their ancestry, age, sex, sex-ual preference, marital status, family and economic conditions, instruction, origin or social conditions, genetic heritage, reduced work capacity, disability, chronic illness, nationality, ethnic origin or race, origin territory, language, religion, politi-cal or ideological convictions and union membership. 6.3    pursuant to decree-law nr 29/2001 of 3rd february, disabled candidates shall be preferred in a situation of equal classification, and said preference supersedes any legal preferences. candidates must declare, on their honour, their respective disability degree, type of disability and communication / expression means to be used during selection period on their application form, under the regulations above. 7.    evaluation criteria: the admitted applications will be evaluated taking into account the quality, timeliness and relevance of the scientific track record (scientific production and research experience) and curriculum of each candidate and their adequacy to the proposed work plan. first phase: curriculum analysis (90%), and motivation letter (10%). second phase: the jury will select for the interview (evaluation: 10%) those candidates who have obtained a score equal or higher than 80% of the maximum score of the first phase. if there are no applications of candidates whose classification score, at the end of the two phases, is not at least 80%, the jury has the right of not selecting any of the candidates. in the event of a tie, the decision will be responsibility of the president of the jury. in the interview, the candidate should present his/her cv, from which the jury shall stimulate an open debate on its content in the case of foreign candidates residing outside  portugal , the interview will be con-ducted by videoconference. 7.1    after evaluation of all admitted applications, the jury will write a meeting mi-nute with all process of recruitment, evaluation and selection including an or-dered short list of approved candidates and their respective classification and final decision of the jury. 7.2    the final decision of the jury shall be validated by the head of the institution, who is also in charge of deciding about the hiring. 8.    results: both admitted and excluded candidates list and final classification list shall be posted at isr facilities (pinhal de marrocos, polo ii, coimbra) and all candidates will be notified by email. 9.    preliminary hearing and final decision deadline: pursuant to article 121 of the administrative procedure code, after notified, all candidates have 10 working days to respond. panel?s final decisions are pronounced within a period of 90 days, from application deadline. -- prof. urbano j. nunes isr - institute of systems and robotics and dept. of electrical and computer engineering ? university of coimbra orcid.org/0000-0002-7750-5221 universidade de coimbra - p?lo 2 | p 3030-290 coimbra ?  portugal

subject: research engineer / phd student  position to work on drone delivery in urban environments (project replace  at isr/ist)
content: applications are invited for a fully funded research engineer position,  with the option for a phd scholarship position, at the institute for  systems and robotics (isr), instituto superior t?cnico (ist), university  of lisbon,  portugal . the selected candidate will be part of the research  team of project replace (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__brunojnguerreiro.eu_research_replace&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=saby9qqngvi8vndmqkvss67pyv_r8l7rty7tj7dk934&s=le5kxt984aker4a4jyiq-dmiy7clodnq0qu7cordc0g&e=),  addressing the fast package delivery in urban environments using drones,  explicitly considering their limitations by using drone relays to enable  effective package delivery to destinations that go beyond the flight  range and autonomy of a single drone. this research engineer position targets candidates holding a master  degree (or equivalent). the selected candidate is expected to work on  the following topics, depending on the selected candidate's background,  preference, and experience: task allocation and planning, on-line  planning and control, multi-vehicle close interaction and control to  exchange packages, environment perception and simultaneous localization  and mapping, as well as vehicle and sensor integration for experimental  testing. the research will be conducted at the dynamic systems and ocean robotics  group of the institute for systems and robotics (isr)  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__welcome.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt_projects-5fcat_dsor_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=saby9qqngvi8vndmqkvss67pyv_r8l7rty7tj7dk934&s=xewyzt_hh6kpj54l37gjbay6huhnwo5a0hgry1g-ihq&e=), supervised  by bruno guerreiro and also in close interaction with the rest of the  project and group research team. isr/ist is the home to more than 40  phds and part of the larsys (laboratory for robotics and engineering  systems - https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.larsys.pt&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=saby9qqngvi8vndmqkvss67pyv_r8l7rty7tj7dk934&s=a7ivd7q1dwou_vvksl4xoqy3wwrmoryvzrciwze9crk&e=). isr/ist is engaged in a new generation  of research challenges pushing the frontiers of knowledge, while  offering world-class doctoral training with top universities (e.g.  dual/joint degrees with mit, epfl, cmu) and fueling the collaboration  with industry. isr/ist develops state-of-the-art engineering solutions  and projects with a clear societal impact, and has a long track record  of participation in eu and other international projects  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=saby9qqngvi8vndmqkvss67pyv_r8l7rty7tj7dk934&s=j-fneg0yn1enybab0y19fwzrmu0qwn4l1xsrb65wawy&e=). requirements: the candidates are expected to have a msc of equivalent  degree with strong background in control, robotics, computer science,  aerospace or mechatronics engineering or a mix of these areas. good  programming skills in matlab, c++, python, and experience with ros, are  also expected. the working language is english, so good written and oral  communication skills are also required. application:  ? - deadline: 09-december-2018  ? - duration: 12 months (full time) [the selected candidate will have a  trial period of 12 months after which, if both parties agree, the grant  can be renewed up to the end of the project, which amounts to a total  contract duration of 29 months]  ? - starting date: january 2019  ? - place: isr/ist - ist alameda campus, lisbon,  portugal   ? - institutional announcement:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ist-2did.pt_files_sites_43_bl202-2dist-2did.pdf&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=saby9qqngvi8vndmqkvss67pyv_r8l7rty7tj7dk934&s=005wwbbrwsdmi8cmfgkx88eolfrkyonuy2v8v7sly3u&e= for further information, send an email to  bguerreiro at isr.tecnico.ulisboa.with the following information:  ??? - a cv  ??? - a statement of interest  ??? - grade transcripts for relevant courses https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eracareers.pt_opportunities_index.aspx-3ftask-3dglobal-26jobid-3d105377&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=saby9qqngvi8vndmqkvss67pyv_r8l7rty7tj7dk934&s=m2odxrgofnzdns4qjqzsbhs028j_fgji3bx2ujctbno&e= subject: research engineer positions on internet  of things and social robots at isr-univ. coimbra
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) ------------------------------------------------------------------- two research engineer positions at isr - univ. of coimbra,  portugal  topics: internet of things, social robots, smart homes, ambient assisted living, active and healthy ageing application deadline: january 2, 2019 ------------------------------------------------------------------- description of the opportunity   two research engineer positions are available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=vtfnnd_r8gf0x0hp656bwmsg_v6qnzlo3gw5towzzqs&e=),  portugal , under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - innovative initiatives for the promotion of active aging in the euroace region?, with the ref. poctep-0043_euroage_4_e, funded by the interreg v a  spain  -  portugal  program (poctep 2014-2020). the euroage project aims at fostering autonomous healthy life, mainly in elderly people but also in people with some degree of dependency, through the promotion of innovative initiatives based on information and communication technologies provided by the patterns participating in the project. the project involves  portugal - spain  cross-border cooperation of partners from euroace region, a region that covers centro and alentejo regions in  portugal , and extremadura region in  spain , which is a territory in iberian peninsula heavily affected by the ageing of the population. the research team from isr - university of coimbra that participates in the euroage project has been demonstrating and validating with elderly people the use of social robots, internet of things, and smart homes as key technologies to promote active and healthy ageing, through cognitive, socio-emotional stimulation and physical activity promotion, thus contributing to quality of life enhancement and increased healthy life expectancy, mainly in the elderly population. the following video illustrates the team?s recent developments: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__cloud.isr.uc.pt_index.php_s_wgq5od0fblmxnsq_download&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=xxjb-tg6gjqypovqzcrsdrf7bk3ynawfekcwwp8h0kc&e= application requirements   the eligible candidates must hold a **m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science obtained in a university located in a country that is a member of the european higher education area (i.e. in a country that ratified the bolonha process)**, and must have **nationality from a country belonging to the schengen area, or hold a passport containing a travel visa to remain or live in a country belonging to the schengen area**. the candidates must have high oral and written proficiency in english if her/his mother tongue is not the portuguese. profile of prospective candidates  the ideal candidate would have: excellent software development skills in c++, python and linux os; solid experience in software development for mobile robots using ros (robot operating system); experience in protocols for devices used in internet of things, and/or computer vision, and/or human-robot interaction; excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills; and high motivation to get involved in the euroage project. application procedure applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate; ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter ? the candidate must demonstrate that she/he fulfills all the application requirements and possesses a suitable professional and research profile for the position. **important notice**: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=jaztaq_0yakvwnhvoqmulkdsfbofbwag_ztr08z7ygw&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, mobile robotics, iot, computer vision, or human-robot interaction; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in mid-january 2019 before the winning candidates are selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]deec.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer positions in euroage project?, **no later than january 2, 2019**. ______ rui p. rocha, ph.d. assistant professor institute of systems and robotics dept. of electrical and computer engineering university of coimbra universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]deec.uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__home.deec.uc.pt_-7erprocha&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=9dws7gahsnz5sxtz34xds8hhovwrsha3aojgbvtk-da&e= _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec framework programmes, e.g. projects bacs and irps in fp6, projects prometheus, handle, and social robot in fp7, and project growmeup in h2020.  portugal  is a member of the european union and is an excellent place to study and do research. discover why at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__study-2dresearch.pt&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=4lmvciohv-1yejhoiuuaj9zgwrt2qb9yikc8k4oqgu0&e= .
